Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.generic

Class SortWithHelper<X>

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.generic.SortWithHelper<X>
Type Parameters:
X - underlying type which extends Comparable.
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProcessingSort<X>, Sort<X>, AutoCloseable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClassificationSorter, InsertionSortComparator, SortWithComparableHelper
public abstract class SortWithHelper<X> extends Object implements ProcessingSort<X>
Base class for Sort with a non-comparable Helper.

    • SortWithHelper

      public SortWithHelper(Helper<X> helper)
      Constructor for SortWithHelper, which initializes the sort using the provided Helper.
      Parameters:
      helper - the Helper instance that provides utilities and operations necessary for the sorting process.

    • SortWithHelper

      public SortWithHelper(String description, Comparator<X> comparator, int N, int nRuns, Config config)
      Constructor for SortWithHelper which initializes a sorting helper using the provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      description - a string describing the sorting process or usage.
      comparator - a comparator that determines the order of elements to be sorted.
      N - the size of the dataset that the sort is intended to handle.
      nRuns - the number of runs or executions the helper is expected to perform.
      config - a configuration object containing settings or parameters for the sort/helper.

    • postProcess

      public void postProcess(X[] xs)
      Method to post-process an array after sorting.

      In this implementation, we delegate the post-processing to the helper.

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

    • isSorted

      public boolean isSorted(X[] xs)
      Return true if xs is sorted, i.e., has no inversions.
      Parameters:
      xs - an array of Xs.
      Returns:
      true if each successive element is greater than (or equal to) its predecessor. Otherwise, false.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the string representation of this object by delegating to the associated Helper's toString method.

      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of this object, as provided by the Helper.

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the SortWithHelper instance and releases any associated resources.

      This method ensures that the instance is closed only once by checking the "open" flag. If the helper-associated resources need to be released, it delegates the close operation to the helper's close method, provided the "closeHelper" flag is set to true.

      It is important to call this method to free resources and maintain efficiency, especially in cases where the SortWithHelper instance or its helper manages external resources.

      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Sort<X>
